org.apache.hadoop.net

Class SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.net.SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool
  • Enclosing class:
    SocketIOWithTimeout

    private static class SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool
extends Object
    This maintains a pool of selectors. These selectors are closed once they are idle (unused) for a few seconds.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool.SelectorInfo get(SelectableChannel channel)
      Takes one selector from end of LRU list of free selectors.
      private void release(SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool.SelectorInfo info)
      puts selector back at the end of LRU list of free selectos.
      (package private) int select(SelectableChannel channel, int ops, long timeout)
      Waits on the channel with the given timeout using one of the cached selectors.
      private void trimIdleSelectors(long now)

    • Method Detail

      • select

        int select(SelectableChannel channel,
         int ops,
         long timeout)
     throws IOException
        Waits on the channel with the given timeout using one of the cached selectors. It also removes any cached selectors that are idle for a few seconds.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        ops -
        timeout -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • get

        private SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool.SelectorInfo get(SelectableChannel channel)
                                                   throws IOException
        Takes one selector from end of LRU list of free selectors. If there are no selectors awailable, it creates a new selector. Also invokes trimIdleSelectors().
        Parameters:
        channel -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • release

        private void release(SocketIOWithTimeout.SelectorPool.SelectorInfo info)
        puts selector back at the end of LRU list of free selectos. Also invokes trimIdleSelectors().
        Parameters:
        info -

      • trimIdleSelectors

        private void trimIdleSelectors(long now)
        Closes selectors that are idle for IDLE_TIMEOUT (10 sec). It does not traverse the whole list, just over the one that have crossed the timeout.
